Flub.Name: Erosion
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: None
Flub.Description: Don't apply Phase 1. Phase 2, if selected, will still be applied.

Flub.Name: Gaea Classic
Flub.Description: Apply the classic Gaea erosion simulation.

Flub.Name: Low Sediments
Flub.Description: Classic erosion with lower sediment production.

Flub.Name: Two Pass
Flub.Description: Repeat the erosion 2 times to emphasize the erosion.

Flub.Name: Four Pass
Flub.Description: Repeat the erosion 4 times. Use this sparingly as the effect can be quite pronounced.

Flub.Name: Strength
Flub.Description: Sets the strength of fluvial erosion. This parameter controls the sediment transport capacity, that is how much of dissolved minerals water can carry. This parameter can be set to value that is higher than 1.0, this can speed up the erosion process, but also can result in lesser erosion quality, especially if erosion softness value is high too.

Flub.Name: Density
Flub.Description: Controls the density of rock material. The softer rock is, the faster is erosion process but may produce bulbous deposits.

Flub.Name: Material
Flub.Description: Defines the general material of the terrain, ranging from fine sand to large rocks, or a mix of both.

Flub.Name: Channel Depth
Flub.Description: This parameter controls the amount of downcutting, or vertical erosion. This results in deeper channels, and can be useful for getting mountain ranges.

Flub.Name: Channel Width
Flub.Description: This parameter controls the width of the channels by creating sediment deposits in the base of the channels.

Flub.Name: Deposits
Flub.Description: This controls the amount of sedimentary deposits generated by the erosion process.

Flub.Name: Removal
Flub.Description: This parameter can reduce the amount of sediments generated during erosion, creating deeper channels.

Flub.Name: Phase 2
Flub.Description: Applies a second phase from one of several pre-defined "recipes".

Flub.Name: None
Flub.Description: Do not apply a Phase 2 recipe.

Flub.Name: Rivers
Flub.Description: Create rivers from the steepest slopes.

Flub.Name: Channels
Flub.Description: Create multiple, smaller scale channels.

Flub.Name: Low Deposits
Flub.Description: Create a powerful deposits and talus in the lower altitudes.

Flub.Name: Pitted Surface
Flub.Description: Create a rough, pitted surface with thousands of tiny pits and crater-like formations.

Flub.Name: Hawaii Furrows
Flub.Description: Create deep furrows similar to the Hawaiian islands.

Flub.Name: Collapsed
Flub.Description: Create low collapses in deposition areas.

Flub.Name: Other
Flub.Description: T

Flub.Name: Bulk
Flub.Description: Increases the bulk of the terrain before eroding. When using strong settings, having some bulk can help prevent the terrain from eroding too much and losing its shape.

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.

Flub.Name: Deterministic (Slow)
Flub.Description: Parallel processing using all CPU cores can create small variations every time the node is built. You can enable Deterministic processing to ensure the exact same shape is produced every time. However, this will force the algorithm to reduce its parallelism and use a single CPU core.
